poem:
### The Hawk's Shadow

In the field, a shadow swept low,  
talons glinting beneath a dawn  
of hardened skies, where leaders  
in their high nests shriek and tear  
at peace's thin cloaks. A prophet  
turns; hears a chorus of cries  
rustle the leaves—too late, too late,  
when the roots are scorched,  
and silence crowns the ashes.
